ovdesc.p: The EB.MESSAGE table allows the production of SWIFT message MT111 Request for stop payment of a cheque. This is produced via the Delivery module.

Only one stop instruction for one Account number is maintained on a record, and only one message can be raised at a time. Amendment to authorised record is not allowed, and a new message would have to be raised for a new stop on the same account.

desc.p: This field may contain either the reason for stopping the payment of the cheque or a request for reimbursement authorisation.
Contains an Enquiry called - List of DE.TRANSLATION Query Codes.
A maximum of 6 multi-values allowed.
Up to 35 type S (SWIFT) characters.

Identifies the incoming SWIFT message

Incoming Swift message detail, which created the EB.MSSAGe.111 record, is held here.
It contains full information along with tag, which is available in the Block 4 of Incoming Swift message.
The information stored here is as it is received.
Validation Rules:
No Input - Internal field.

desc.p: Identifies any process errors that may have occurred during the Swift Inward message processing using OFS.GLOBUS.MANAGER.
The process error may be due to Non mapping of Incoming message tag details in payment .stop Application or Errors encountered in payment stop application during Inward Message processing.

When Inward processing encounter any error related to this application, the Payment.stop records will be built as normal, except they will have a Record Status of 'IHLD'. The actual Error details will be held in this field.
But when it encounter non mapping of Tags in payment stop, Payment stop will not be put on Hold but stores tag details for information
No Input - Internal multivalued field.
Valid input YES or NO
Message output is suppressed when set to NO.

This field determines the option (A, B or D) for field DRAWER.BANK (i.e. Tag 52 in SWIFT Message MT112).
BIC:

This option (Option A) specifies the ISO Bank Identifier Code (BIC), and optionally the account or clearing code of the financial institution, initiating the transaction on behalf of itself or the ordering customer.
LOCATION:
This option (Option B) specifies the branch and optionally the account or clearing code of the financial institution, initiating the transaction on behalf of itself or the ordering customer.
ADDRESS:

This option (Option D) specifies the name and address and optionally the account or clearing code of the financial institution, initiating the transaction on behalf of itself or the ordering customer.
